Authors: Chao Ge Wang, Josef Vlasák, Yu Cheng Dai
Title:
Phylogeny and diversity of Bjerkandera (Polyporales,
Basidiomycota), including four new species from South America and
Asia
Abstract:
Four new species of Bjerkandera, viz. B. ecuadorensis, B.
fulgida, B. minispora, and B. resupinata spp. nov., are described
respectively from tropical America and Asia (B. ecuadorensis from
Ecuador, B. fulgida from China and Thailand, B. minispora and B.
resupinata from China). B. ecuadorensis is characterised by dark gray to
black pore surface, a monomitic hyphal system, hyaline to
yellowish-brown generative hyphae, and ellipsoid basidiospores measuring
3.94.5 × 2.73 μm. B. fulgida is distinguished from the other species in
the genus by clay buff to pale brown and shiny pore surface. B.
minispora is characterised by white tomentose pore mouth and small
basidiospores measuring 3.14.2 × 22.8 μm. B. resupinata is characterised
by resupinate basidiocarps, pinkish buff to pale brownish pore surface,
and ellipsoid to broadly ellipsoid basidiospores measuring 4.56 × 3.24.1
µm. All these new species grow on angiosperm trunks or rotten wood, and
cause a white rot. The closely related taxa to four new species are
discussed. An identification key to the ten accepted species of
Bjerkandera is provided, and a phylogeny comprising all known
Bjerkandera species is provided.
